p: Several EOs, when used as anesthetics or sedative for manipulation and/or transport, exhibit antioxidant capacity ( Tables 1, 2). This antioxidant activity is also observed when the EOs are used at concentrations lower than those that induce sedation and as dietary supplements ( Tables 1â€“ 3). Thus, the antioxidant effects of several EOs are not only due to the possibility of lower ROS production when fish are sedated or anesthetized.
